SEARCH
Package nl.pim16aap2.bigdoors.core.tooluser.step

Interface IStep

All Known Implementing Classes:
Step
public interface IStep
Represents a series of StepExecutors that together form a procedure.
Author:
Pim

  • Method Details

    • getName

      String getName()
      Returns:
      The name of this step.

    • getLocalizedMessage

      String getLocalizedMessage()
      Returns:
      The localized String that belongs to the current IStep.

    • waitForUserInput

      boolean waitForUserInput()
      Checks if this type of IStep waits for user input or not.

      Most steps will usually wait for user input (e.g. providing a name, or location, etc.). However, some steps can be executed immediately. One such example is a finishing step, that runs after all other steps have been completed and processes the final result of all the steps that have been executed.

      Returns:
      True if this type of IStep waits for user input.

    • getStepPreparation

      @Nullable @Nullable Runnable getStepPreparation()
      Returns:
      The action to be taken to prepare this step, if any.

    • getStepExecutor

      Optional<StepExecutor> getStepExecutor()
      Returns:
      The StepExecutor for the current step.

    • skip

      boolean skip()
      Checks if this step should be skipped based on certain criteria defined by the implementation.
      Returns:
      True if this step should be skipped.

    • isImplicitNextStep

      boolean isImplicitNextStep()
      Checks if this step should 'automatically' proceed to the next step if the result of running the getStepExecutor() is true.

      See StepExecutor.apply(Object).

      Returns:
      True if the successful execution of this step's executor should cause it to go to the next step automatically.
